page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: In our block there is one village called{Cuxton}which is situated in a dry valley among chalk hills. The main feature of this area is beautiful woodland criss-crossed by public footpaths. The best known is the{North {Downs Way,}formally the{Pilgrims' Way. Part of the{woodland}is an area of Special Scientific Interest. There are six farms in the block. Most of these are arable but a few have sheep and cows. A number of{disused chalk pits is evidence that chalk has been excavated here, for over a hundred years, for the manufacture of cement. The{Rugby Portland Cement Works}at Halling is the only major industry. {The River Medway}flows through this area, and is tidal at this point.
